    Created by kjevo on 2/21/17.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GridHandler(double width, double height)
      Sets up a new pane creates the array list containing the UI nodes in the grid and sets width and height

      • GridHandler

        public GridHandler(double width,
                   double height)
        Sets up a new pane creates the array list containing the UI nodes in the grid and sets width and height
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the pane that the grid handler creates
        height - the height of the pane that the grid handler creates

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxXAndMaxYFromItemsInGrid

        public com.sun.javafx.geom.Vec2d getMaxXAndMaxYFromItemsInGrid()
        Loops through the gird array list to find the max X and max Y of the grid.
        Returns:
        Vec2d with max x of grid and max y of grid.

      • getGridAsScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene getGridAsScene()
        Returns the scene as a grid.
        Returns:
        a Scene containing of all grid items of this particular grid.

      • calculateAllPositionAndSize

        public void calculateAllPositionAndSize()
        Loop to recalculate all the positions and sizes of the UI Nodes

      • calculatePositionAndSize

        public void calculatePositionAndSize(javafx.scene.Node UINode,
                                     int xPos,
                                     int maxX,
                                     int yPos,
                                     int maxY,
                                     double padding,
                                     int colSpan,
                                     int rowSpan)
        Calculates the position and size of a grid item.
        Parameters:
        UINode - The UI Node to calculate the position and size of
        xPos - The x position on the grid it takes
        maxX - The max amount of grid items on the X side of the grid
        yPos - The y position on the grid it takes
        maxY - The max amount of grid items on the Y side of the grid
        padding - The amount of padding between the grid items
        colSpan - The column span of the item(how 'big' it is, ie if you put in 2 it takes 2 positions of X making it twice as large horizontally on the grid.)
        rowSpan - The row span of the item(how 'big' it is ie if you put in 2 it takes 2 positions of Y making it twice as large vertically on the grid.)

      • add

        public void add(int xPos,
                int yPos,
                javafx.scene.Node UINode,
                boolean overwriteOldItem)
        Adds a UI node to the grid. Just a callback to the function with row span and column span but with both set to 1
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x position on the grid it takes
        yPos - The Y position on the grid it takes
        UINode - The UI Node to add to the grid
        overwriteOldItem - Whether to overwrite the item in the grid position if one is already there

      • add

        public void add(int xPos,
                int yPos,
                javafx.scene.Node UINode,
                int colSpan,
                int rowSpan,
                boolean overwriteOldItem)
        Adds a UI node to the grid.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x position on the grid it takes
        yPos - The Y position on the grid it takes
        UINode - The UI Node to add to the grid
        colSpan - The row span of the item(how 'big' it is ie if you put in 2 it takes 2 positions of Y making it twice as large vertically on the grid.)
        rowSpan - The column span of the item(how 'big' it is, ie if you put in 2 it takes 2 positions of X making it twice as large horizontally on the grid.
        overwriteOldItem - Whether to overwrite the item in the grid position if one is already there
